title: For the 2nd time posting this
body: I keep getting a PVP.net Patcher Kernel has stopped working error and I've tried all the fixes suggested by Riot in past threads on this subject. Nothing seems to be working as I'm free for the next few days and I'm afraid I might not be able to play LOL. I've been playing LOL for about 4 years now (left the game a few times for about 7 months over-all) but never had this problem before. And I've switched computers only once and I've been playing it for a year and a half now on this one. I just finished trying updating my windows as a last attempt to fix it but it still didn't work, how can I fix this?

replies.body: Sorry to hear the issue is still happening.  If the permissions guide didn't help, double check antivirus settings that could get in the way.  Otherwise, download our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to obtain some logs, and attach them to a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Our tech team can take a look with your directly and assist in your ticket, we'll see you there!

Hopefully you can get a Rioter to respond here with some more links for you, but one thing you should try is the [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool). It’s the official Riot tool to check the game files to make sure they’re all working properly.

Failing that, you may wish to simply completely uninstall League and then reinstall.
I already reinstalled it, and I think that I need to be able to patch the game in order to use the repair tool since it's asking me to select a file that's not installed yet.
Oh noes. I have sadly no clue then. Hopefully a red will see ya this time!
